snippet: Professor Katz, who taught at the University of Pennsylvania and was a founder of its urban studies program, challenged the prevailing view in the 1980s and ’90s that poverty stemmed from the bad habits of the poor.
abstract: Michael B Katz, influential historian and social theorist who challenged the prevailing view in the 1980s and ’90s that poverty stemmed from the bad habits of the poor, dies at age 75.
lead_paragraph: Professor Katz, who taught at the University of Pennsylvania and was a founder of its urban studies program, challenged the prevailing view in the 1980s and ’90s that poverty stemmed from the bad habits of the poor.

headline.main: Michael Katz, Who Challenged View of Poverty, Dies at 75
headline.print_headline: Michael Katz, 75, Who Challenged View of Poverty, Dies
